intro: Cynanchum cristalinense, commonly known as the crystalline dogbane, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae, which includes milkweeds and related genera. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, arranged in clusters, and produce a milky sap that can be toxic. Cynanchum cristalinense is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
